msbt.message: The highlight of any Turkey Day is the standing dinner, of course.Until then, we'll just be standing here, thinking about gourmet food but not eating anythingI don't know if I'm gonna make it!
Ahhhyou can tell it's Turkey Day by taking a deep breath. I can smell home cooking across the island!

I fully intend to learn everything I can from our celebrity chef visitor today, .Like, what are the trendiest ingredients right now? Who's the most famous client he's cooked for?You know, just basic cooking stuff.

Oh, are you Franklin's sous-chef today? That's French for "chef who actually does all the work."Speaking ofyou might want to check in with some of the folks who are cooking at home.I bet they have all kinds of gourmet ingredients to share with you
I hear you'll be helping Franklin whip up some of his world-famous dishes today, !Oh, I can just imagine the sublime flavors and mouthfeels you two will be working on Save some for me!
I'm LOVING what I'm smelling so far, but are there even more dishes on their way?Ooh, it's like being at a film festival, but for food.
This is really amazing, right? That we can have world-class dining with local ingredients?I guess with a celebrity chef, anything is possible. Ah, celebrities. They really are better than us.
, is that a star-studded buffet or what? It almost looks TOO good!
Someone hold me. I'm going weak in the knees at the sight of this much incredible food.And it's all made from locally-grown ingredients. That is SO trendy right now, !
Bravo to the chef! And to everyone else who helped. It all looks so good I could justDANCE!
There's so much to consider when preparing gourmet food. The plating, the presentation, the sourcingAnd the taste, I guess.
I'm not complaining, but I also wouldn't complain if there was more food, .
You can taste the difference when a world-class chef cooks something, trust me.I'd pay extra just to have a real pro microwave some for me, .
My compliments to the chef! Would someone call him over here so I can thank him personally?No? Well, I'll just shout it out. IT WAS ALL SO GOOD! THANK YOU!

Ahh, the nosefeel of all that food is intoxicating, . I can't wait to experience its mouthfeel. Not to mention its eyefeel. Ooh! And its feelfeel.<10_4 /> Not sure I like the lookfeel you're giving me now
You know what I like to say at the end of a fantastic meal? Trés bueno, my compliments to the chef!I don't know what it means, actually, but it's a kind of a gourmet "word salad," I'm told.
Mmmthe smells absolutely delicioso!Thank you for providing the chef with the he needed to make it happen.
I'm being drawn in by an invisible powerand it smells exactly like !And you provided the fresh that the chef used, right?Well, my compliments to you and the chef, !
Mmmthe smells absolutely delicioso!Thank you for providing the chef with the manila clams he needed to make it happen.
I'm being drawn in by an invisible powerand it smells exactly like !And you provided the fresh manila clams that the chef used, right?Well, my compliments to you and the chef, !
It's Turkey Day! And you know what that means, hm? is cooking!
Turkey Day is all about sharing great food with friends and family.And maybe a little bit of showing off in the kitchen Ha HA!
Now, I'm all set to chef up something incredible, but there's one ingredient I'm missing
I don't always follow a recipe, but there is a certain special ingredient I need
Hrm Ah! I remembered. I need some !Any chance you could pick some up for me? We can trade! I'll give you some of what I have.
Hold on You have the exact thing I need. !This is fate, . Will you consider trading a little for one of my ingredients?
Sure!
Not right now.
Oh, no problem. Sorry to spring that on you. But you know, if you do find that you have extra laterI might still be interested in trading.
I'm actually in a tough spot. I need a bit of to make my signature recipe.
Here, take this!
Wish I could help.
Waitis that the distinctly delicious scent of some that I smell?If so, that's JUST what I need for my Turkey Day recipe! Will you trade me for another ingredient?
Sure!
Sorry, not interested.
OK, no problem. But if you DO find yourself with extra, you know where to find me if you want to trade.
That's cool. Just let me know if you change your mind, and I'm sure we can work something out.
Last-second change of heart, huh? Happens to me all the time.
Oh, uh That's not exactly what I was looking for. I needed some , remember?We can try again if you find what I need, .
Merci beacoup, !Turkey Day just got a little bit more delicious, thanks to you.Here, see if you can use this at all. It's some !
Last but not least, I've got something even more valuable than a secret ingredient for you A cooking tip!
OK, so when you're making a dish like clam chowder, obviously you're gonna put manila clams in itBut if you wanna go to the next levelthe five-star leveltry adding a scallop. Trust me!
So for a dish like clam chowder, it gets a lot of richness from the manila clams you use.A lot of richness, but not ALL of it! For the richest clam chowder ever, try adding a certain bivalve
So when you're making pumpkin pie, you'd use pumpkin, right? Ha HA! That'd be your first mistake.You can't just use one pumpkin. You gotta use all the types of pumpkin if you want a designer pie.
Making pumpkin pie is easy, right? You got a pumpkin, you cook a little, and! You got a pie.But if you want a signature pie, try using ALL of the colors of pumpkin!
You can make gratin out of almost anything and it's gonna taste pretty good, .But if you throw a little Dungeness crab in there? MWAH. Chef's kiss.
You could make a gratin out of and it'd taste pretty OK. Don't actually try that!But if you want to make some VIP level gratin, try adding a certain type of crab,
If you can make a delicate fish meunière, resplendent with butter and herbs Sorry, I lost myself for a moment. Anyway, barred knifejaw makes fish meunière really sharp. Ha HA!

Anytime you're cooking with herbs and butter, you're doing pretty good. So fish meunière is always a hit.But here's a pro tip. Try using some kind of striped fish to add more "zazz." You'll thank me later!
You know what the REAL secret ingredient was today?<10_4 /> YOU! Thanks for trading with me, !
I couldn't have done it without you, .I'll dedicate at least one of my culinary stars in your name!
So how did the spread look out there? <10_4 />Ooh, I want to go check it out for myself
, cooking is hard.Especially cleaning up afterward!
When I'm cooking something really involved, I like to think about the folks eating the finished product.It makes me jealous, so I work faster, .
Sorry, unless you're casting for a major motion picture, I can't stop cooking right now. It's Turkey Day!
Are you here for the famous Turkey Day?<10_4 /> Hope you have a great time!
OK, I've got all the ingredients and my recipes in ordernow I actually have to COOK. Oh.I guess I don't really have time to relax and talk, .
I hope your Turkey Day was sequel- worthy, ! Ooh, I can see it nowTurkey Day 2: More Please!
Ugh, Turkey Day was just so good! We shared in the island's bounty and cooked beautiful food togetherI'd do that EVERY dayif I could also fit in my usual six hours of prestige TV watching.

You know what? I learned something today, .I don't just cook for the glory and glamour. I cook to see those smiling faces chowing down on my food.And maybe, one day, a licensing deal for a chain of restaurants with my name on the front

Well, I had some great food, I got better at cooking, and I learned a TON this Turkey Day.But it's not all about ME. We all did it. There's no I in team, and you can't spell gustatory delight without "us"!
AhhI can't believe Turkey Day is over already. Qué rico!That's Spanish for "everything was soooooo good, and I feel like I'm living in a dream, !"
That standing dinner in the plaza was the best. Maybe I'll eat ALL of my meals in the plazaNah, you're right. It wouldn't be as special if I did it all the time. And I'm a loud chewer, I know.
There's nothing I can say that does justice to Franklin's cooking. It speaks for itself!I'd like to think my cooking speaks for itself too. It has an Italian accent and says things like MANGIAMO!
